question: when was the canadian pacific railway started and finished
api_result: The Canadian Pacific Railway (CPR) was officially started in 1881 and completed in 1885. The railway was built to connect the eastern provinces of Canada with British Columbia in the west, facilitating trade and travel across the country. The last spike was driven on November 7, 1885, at Craigellachie, British Columbia, marking the completion of the transcontinental railway.
